result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan Mae Mihalko

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on March 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 8, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 7, 2023 at 02:15 pm.

2:06 PM  Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court, in custody - in person.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF12, 22CF143, 22CF169 and 22CM27. State -  here for STC/PH/BBH. Halyburton -  waiving PH and provided paperwork to the Court. Court has waiver of right to PH, finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right t PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Halyburton has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG to all charges on 22CF169. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for PTC/PLEAS/JT. Court will now hear the bail bond on 22CM27 as the poster has requested her money back. Halyburton states that Mihalko informed her that the $500.00 cash bond was Mihalko's, not Whitecloud. Whitecloud disagrees - states that money was hers. Halyburton makes further argument on the bond to probe that the money is Ms. Mihalko's. Court will have Ms. Whitecloud sworn in and warns about perjury, Court asks some questions prior to placing Ms. Whitecloud under oath. Court want Ms. Whitecloud in person, recess to do that. Recalled at 2:24 PM. Clerk swears in Adina Whitecloud. Court again advises Ms. Whitecloud that she is under oath and perjury. Defendant now wants to talk to her attorney first. Court will allow that. Court will set this for a BBH on 11/9/22 at 11:45 AM for 22CM27. Halyburton now wants to be heard on bond on 22CF169. Court will allow. Halyburton - bond - asks for a signature bond or $500.00 cash bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond on 22CF169- continues bond at this point.
State's Discovery Update Cover Letter
State's Initial Discovery Cover Letter

11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko. Called 22CF12 and 22CM27. State here for PH on 22CF12, believes it will be a waiver. Halyburton agrees and provides court with waiver form. Court goes over waiver with Mihalko, finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Halyburton has received a copy, will proceed to ARGN, waives reading and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas, continues bond and will have set for JT. 22CM27 will also be set for JT. If resolved, contact JA for PLEAS date.
And certificate of Appearance TC

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko. Court calls 22CF12 and 22CM27. State - here for AIA on each case. Halyburton and Mihalko have complaints, waives further reading, enters NG plea on 22CM27, asks for PH within time limits on 22CF12. Court continues bond for both cases, sets CF for PH and CM for STC on 7/7/22 at 11:00 AM, sets bond at $750.00 cash on each case, no conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Arrested

9:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Megan Mae Mihalko. Court calls 22CF12 and 22CM27. Halyburton does not know why her client is not in here, not has a message from her client stating that she will be here shortly. The posters of the bond, Darrell Ward and Shelly Vladik, are in Court ask they requested their bond money back. Court will not forfeit the bonds, will release it to the posters, issues bench warrants, body or $750.00 on each case.
Bail/bond hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
from poster to have bond returned to them.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:55 AM Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Megan Mae Mihalko appeared by video means. Mihalko states she is still waiting to hear from SPD, has called them frequently. Court instructs to contact SPD every day. Mihalko states that she leave today for 30 day treatment center. Court - must make sure she keeps in contact with them. continues bond, set for AIA on 5/25/22 at 9:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No consumption of alcohol.

10:12 AM Defendant Megan Mae Mihalko in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Megan Mae Mihalko appeared by video means from FOSO. Mihalko does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Mihalko understands charges and penalties, has not yet contacted SPD on her other matter yet, no source of income, has another matter that is set for 3/16/22 at 10:00 AM. Court instructs to contact SPD today, if not eligible - hire own or can ask for court appointed attorney paperwork. Mihalko understands. State - bond - $500.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court so orders, sets for AIA on 3/16/22 at 10:00 AM.
